intro: [WRONG START] Embilia palauensis, commonly known as the Palau embelia, is a small shrub native to the Caroline Islands. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces small, berry-like fruits that are typically red when mature. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species in its native habitat.
